name: Base ModSpec
desc: A collection of notes, guidelines, and practical examples that enable one to adapt and apply this modification to various hulls.

name: Corrupted Nanoforge
desc:
A powerful and versatile manufacturing "black box", capable of building itself out to an industrial scale, given the necessary raw materials and human assistance.

This one has seen better days, and is incapable of reliably producing defect-free components. Nonetheless, having access to a nanoforge at all is a step up as far as starship construction goes.

Must be installed in Heavy Industry to be utilized.

name: Pristine Nanoforge
desc:
A powerful and versatile manufacturing "black box", capable of building itself out to an industrial scale, given the necessary raw materials and human assistance.

This one is good as new, at least according to its on-board diagnostics. In practice, getting defect-free starship components is still a challenge given the overall state of manufacturing in the Sector, but this nanoforge is as good as it gets.

Must be installed in Heavy Industry to be utilized.

name: Synchrotron Core
desc:
A specialized nanoforge, loaded with firmware and seed nano-tech to build itself out into a Synchrotron that allows industrial-scale antimatter production.

Must be installed in a Fuel Production facility to be utilized.

name: Low Tech Blueprint Package
desc: Enables heavy industry to construct the more common ship hulls, weapons, and fighter LPCs from the "low tech" school of design.

name: Midline Blueprint Package
desc: Enables heavy industry to construct the more common ship hulls, weapons, and fighter LPCs from the "midline" school of design.

name: High Tech Blueprint Package
desc: Enables heavy industry to construct the more common ship hulls, weapons, and fighter LPCs from the "high tech" school of design.

name: Missile Blueprint Package
desc: Enables heavy industry to construct a range of the more common missile weapons.

name: Pirate Blueprint Package
desc: A collection of hacks, after-market modification specs, and partially successful attempts at corrupted blueprint recovery. Enables heavy industry to construct the low quality but combat-capable hulls more commonly used by pirates and other undesirables.

name: Luddic Path Blueprint Package
desc: A collection of hacks and after-market modification specs that enables heavy industry to construct the hulls more commonly used by members of the Luddic Path.

name: Luddic Church Blueprint Package
desc: A collection of hacks and after-market modification specs that enables heavy industry to construct hulls bearing Luddic Church markings. Since the modifications are cosmetic in nature, the hulls produced are otherwise pristine.

name: XIV Battlegroup Blueprint Package
desc: A set of blueprints that enable heavy industry to produce the near-legendary hulls employed by the Hegemony-founding XIV Battlegroup. The continued existence - and location - of these blueprints is subject of many rumors.

name: Hegemony Auxiliary Blueprint Package
desc: A collection of modified blueprints that bring several civilian craft up to mil-spec or simply add Hegemony markings. Created shortly after the Collapse, some of these blueprints improve hull performance without the increased incidence of d-mods associated with later blueprint hacking efforts.

name: Base Ship Blueprint
desc: Enables heavy industry to construct ship hulls described by this blueprint.

name: Base Weapon Blueprint
desc: Enables heavy industry to construct ship weapons described by this blueprint.

name: Base Fighter Blueprint
desc: Enables heavy industry to construct fighter LPCs described by this blueprint.

name: Base Industry Blueprint
desc: Contains the technological specifications needed to construct a planet-side industry or structure.
